metadata.title: CVE-2022-24714 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Icinga Web 2 is an open source monitoring web interface, framework andcommand-line interface. Installations of Icinga 2 with the IDO writerenabled are affected. If you use service custom variables in rolerestrictions, and you regularly decommission service objects, users withsaid roles may still have access to a collection of content. Note that thisonly applies if a role has implicitly permitted access to hosts, due topermitted access to at least one of their services. If access to a host ispermitted by other means, no sensible information has been disclosed tounauthorized users. This issue has been resolved in versions 2.8.6, 2.9.6and 2.10 of Icinga Web 2.

criterions.comment: icingaweb2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
